com.teamten.chess
Class Board

java.lang.Object
  com.teamten.chess.Board

public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a chess board and the pieces on it.

getIndex

public static int getIndex(int file,
                           int rank)
Return the index into the SIZE*SIZE array given a rank and file.

Parameters:
file - the file or column, 1 to 8. 1 is the queen-side rook.
rank - the rank or row, 1 to 8. 1 is white's back row.

getRelativeIndex

public static int getRelativeIndex(int index,
                                   int deltaFile,
                                   int deltaRank)
Like getIndex(), but offset by the delta rank and file. Returns -1 if off-board.

public static int getFile(int index)
Return the file (1 to SIZE) for this index.

fromPosition

public static int fromPosition(java.lang.String position)
Return an index given a position like "e2".

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position is poorly formatted.

getAttackingPieceIndex

public int getAttackingPieceIndex(int index,
                                  int attackingSide)
If the given square is attacked by the given side, returns the index of (any) attacking piece. Otherwise returns -1.

getCheckIndex

public int getCheckIndex(int side)
If the king of the specified side is in check, return (any) index of an attacking piece. Otherwise return -1.

verifyMoveLegal

public int verifyMoveLegal(Move move)
Verifies whether this move is legal. This only checks for things like whether the king is in check as a result of this move. It does not check to see if the piece can actually move this way. Use isMoveValid() for that.

Returns:
the index of a piece that's making this move not legal, or -1 if the move is legal.

verifyMoveValid

public void verifyMoveValid(Move move)
                     throws IllegalMoveException
This fully checks this move for validity: the side whose turn it is to move, the motion of the piece, and the legality (in check, etc.). This is a relatively slow method. Call it at user-interface speeds.

Throws:
IllegalMoveException - if the move is not valid. The exception includes a human-readable string explaining why it's not valid and optionally an index pointing at a piece that's causing a check.

removeIllegalMoves

public void removeIllegalMoves(java.util.List<Move> moveList)
Remove any move that leaves the board in an illegal state (e.g., king in check).

parseMove

public Move parseMove(java.lang.String moveString)
               throws IllegalMoveException
Parse a move like "e2-e4" in the context of this board.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the move can't be parsed or is illegal. The exception message is human-readable.
IllegalMoveException

generateAllMoves

public java.util.List<Move> generateAllMoves(int side,
                                             boolean capturesOnly)
Generates all moves for the side whose turn it is, but does not remove moves that would leave us in check.

print

public void print(java.lang.String indent)
Prints the board to the terminal with each line having the specified indent.

serialize

public java.lang.String serialize()
Serialize the board to a string. Deserialize later with deserialize(). The string contains only URL-safe characters (A-Z, a-z, digits, and periods).

deserialize

public static Board deserialize(java.lang.String str)
Deserialize a board from the string created by serialize().
